title: McDonald’s Stock Is Slipping Because Earnings and Revenue Both Disappointed
text:
McDonald’s stock is falling on Tuesday, following the fast-food giant’s downbeat third-quarter report, which missed top- and bottom-line expectations.

The back story. While plenty of fast-food stocks have jumped in 2019, McDonald’s (ticker: MCD) stock has gained about 15%, trailing the S&P 500’s nearly 20% gain year to date. Still, the company is a favorite among analysts, who like its strong underlying fundamentals, use of technology, embrace of delivery, and tests of meat-alternative products with Beyond Meat (BYND)...
description: Early Tuesday, the burger giant said it earned $2.11 a share, a dime below the $2.21 consensus estimate, on revenue of $5.43 billion, which was also slightly below the $5.47 billion analysts were expecting.
